speaker: Monoco
line: He Who Guards Truth With Lies.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t mind a straightforward path for once. Better than battling through a mountain of Nevrons.

speaker: Sciel
line: No, Verso’s right. Something feels off.

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: Oh, I’m harmless, you don’t need those.

speaker: Verso
line: Well, if you’re harmless, then these weapons will stay harmless too.

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: Touché. Well. Visages invites you to join him in his chamber at the end of this path. I assume that’s why you’re here?

speaker: Sciel
line: Where do the other paths lead?

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: You’re free to traverse them. Masks are not just to obscure. They may also illuminate. Look for the masks that you need.

speaker: Sciel
line: Well. Head straight to the Axon or take the other paths?

speaker: Sciel
line: Destroying these masks seems to hurt him.

speaker: Sciel
line: I know they’re Nevrons, but… witnessing the sorrow of others… I can’t help but feel for them.

speaker: Monoco
line: A noble but tremendously fatal impulse.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah, it definitely hurts him. I think I saw one more path.

speaker: Monoco
line: Normally I enjoy a little destruction, but this doesn’t feel right.

speaker: Lune
line: Monoco, what does that mean, “He Who Guards Truth With Lies?”

speaker: Sciel
line: Guard as in protect? Or guard as in control?

speaker: Verso
line: I think you pissed him off.

speaker: Mask Keeper
line: People want so badly to know, “What’s behind the mask?” Front, back. Recto, verso. Great art is both window and mirror. Whether it’s your mask or theirs.

speaker: Mask Keeper
line: Child, we all need masks, but how you use them, mmm.

speaker: Sciel
line: This mask can’t hurt me. Because it is me.

speaker: Sciel
line: Axon down. Let’s bring this to the Curator.

speaker: Verso
line: That was Verso, wasn’t it? Renoir?

speaker: Maelle
line: Me? You want me to give it to you?

speaker: Maelle
line: I saw- I saw… It was… Renoir?

speaker: Verso
line: I used to see him in my nightmares too. He can be quite traumatising.
